jobDescription: We are seeking someone local to our Torrance, CA location in order to have the ability to work part time hours immediately, and the role is related to Mobility as a Service (MaaS). Student intern will be part of a team that will work on mobility projects. Duties will include, but not limited to: Research, document, and clarify the current state of global smart mobility, shared mobility, and potential new markets.Survey and analyze mobility data and market vehicle data to understand current vehicle use cases and the transition to future mobility services.Propose and justify any new features, use cases, and requirements required for success in these areas.Generate all necessary reports, presentations, or technical documents. Candidate must be currently enrolled in college with a declared major in Engineering or similar field of study, and knowledge/interest in the automotive market and technologies. Able to work a minimum of 20 hours per week, for a minimum of 3 months. Must be a self motivated individual who thrives in a deadline-driven environment, and able to function independently on a day-to-day basis and work in a team environment. Proficient computer skills (MS Excel, Powerpoint and data analysis), and strong communication/interpersonal skills are required. Ability to summarize complex topics into simplified documents for easy understanding.
